intro: Malacothrix foliosa subsp. polycephala, commonly known as the clustered leaf malacothrix, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its dense, often hairy foliage and small, clustered inflorescences. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged in a rosette pattern, contributing to its ornamental appeal. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or arid environments.
